Course Name: ACG 2181 - TRIPLE BOTTOM LINE ACCOUNTING FOR MANAGERS
Course Title: TRIPLE BOTTOM LINE ACCOUNTING FOR MANAGERS
Statewide Course: TRIPLE BOTTOM LINE ACCOUNTING FOR MANAGERS
Course Description: THIS COURSE INTRODUCES STUDENTS TO THE DISCIPLINE OF FINANCIAL AND MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING IN THE CONTEXT OF THE TRIPLE BOTTOM LINE. STUDENTS WILL GAIN A FOUNDATIONAL KNOWLEDGE OF THE PREPARATION OF FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND THEIR ANALYTICAL USE. THE COURSE ALSO EXPLORES USE OF ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL INFORMATION IN THE DECISION-MAKING PROCESS OF GUIDING ORGANIZATIONS TO MEET THE TRIPLE BOTTOM LINE (STRONG PROFITS, HEALTHY ENVIRONMENT, AND VITAL COMMUNITIES).
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
